conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Container A is positioned at the top left, aligned vertically with container G. There is a black baffle below A.
Liquid from A flows downward directly into container G, as it is aligned vertically with this container.
Container B is positioned to the right of A. Below B is a yellow baffle slanted to the right.
Liquid from B flows downward and then to the right, following the yellow baffle, which leads into container F.
Container C is positioned to the right of B. Below C is a white baffle slanted to the right.
Liquid from C flows downward and is directed to the right by the white baffle, leading into container F.
Container D is positioned to the right of C. Below D is a yellow baffle slanted to the left.
Liquid from D flows downward and is directed to the left by the yellow baffle, leading into container E.
The final distribution is: Liquid from A flows into container G, liquid from B flows into container F, liquid from C flows into container F, and liquid from D flows into container E.
Thus, the liquids from A, B, C, and D will flow into containers G, F, F, and E, respectively.
